intro: Cyrtandropsis bismarckiensis, commonly known as the Bismarck Island daisy, is a flowering plant native to the island of Bismarck in the South Pacific. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits that are typically dispersed by wind. Cyrtandropsis bismarckiensis is adapted to coastal environments and thrives in well-drained sandy soils.
